abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the project is to
            contribute to increase the production and productivity of
            irrigated agriculture in the Peru's Coast in order to
            improve the farmer's well-being. There is a remote
            possibility that the execution of project works may cause
            significant damage to natural resources, environmental
            preservation and conservation. Nonetheless, some of the
            environmental impacts are : damage to historic cultural
            heritage areas; use of agro-chemical products; noise, dust
            and air pollution from vehicular and construction
            activities; and potential soil erosion, destruction of
            landscape, and vegetation. Mitigation measures are :
            vehicles to comply with local municipality noise and air
            quality regulations; reject of works with pre-investment
            studies that lack environmental impact study; stop works
            whose technical drawings indicate they affect
            historic-cultural sites; organize community outreach and
            public awareness campaigns on environmental management
            issues; affected land and vegetation will be restored by
            soil leveling and covering grass; and finally; promote the
            application of adequate agronomic practices and train
            farmers in pesticide management.
